This section is non-normative.
The "AES-CTR" algorithm identifier is used to perform encryption and decryption using AES in Counter mode, as described in NIST SP 800-38A [SP800-38A].
The recognized algorithm name for this algorithm is "AES-CTR".

li.p: If any of the members of AesCtrParams are not present in normalizedAlgorithm, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the counter property of normalizedAlgorithm does not have length 16 bytes, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the length property of normalizedAlgorithm is zero or is greater than 128, terminate this algorithm with an error.

Let ciphertext be the result of performing the CTR Encryption operation described in Section 6.5 of NIST SP 800-38A [SP800-38A] using AES as the block cipher, the contents of the counter property of normalizedAlgorithm as the initial value of the counter block, the length property of normalizedAlgorithm as the input parameter m to the standard counter block incrementing functon defined in Appendix B.1 of NIST SP 800-38A [SP800-38A] and plaintext as the input plaintext.
Return ciphertext.
If any of the members of AesCtrParams are not present in normalizedAlgorithm, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the counter property of normalizedAlgorithm does not have length 16 bytes, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the length property of normalizedAlgorithm is zero or is greater than 128, terminate this algorithm with an error.

Let plaintext be the result of performing the CTR Decryption operation described in Section 6.5 of NIST SP 800-38A [SP800-38A] using AES as the block cipher, the contents of the counter property of normalizedAlgorithm as the initial value of the counter block, the length property of normalizedAlgorithm as the input parameter m to the standard counter block incrementing functon defined in Appendix B.1 of NIST SP 800-38A [SP800-38A] and ciphertext as the input ciphertext.
Return plaintext.
If any of the members of AesKeyGenParams are not present in normalizedAlgorithm, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the length property of normalizedAlgorithm is not equal to one of 128, 192 or 256, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If usages contains any entry which is not a case-sensitive string match for one of "encrypt", "decrypt", "wrapKey" or "unwrapKey", terminate this algorithm with an error.

Generate an AES key of length equal to the length property of normalizedAlgorithm.
If the key generation step fails: Terminate this algorithm with an error Otherwise:
Let key be a new Key object representing the generated AES key.
Let algorithm be a new AesKeyAlgorithm.
Set the name property of algorithm to "AES-CTR".
Set the length property of algorithm to equal the length property of normalizedAlgorithm.
Set the algorithm property of key to algorithm.
Set the extractable property of key to be extractable.
Set the keyUsages property of key to be usages.
Return key.
If usages contains an entry which is not a case-sensitive string match for one of "encrypt", "decrypt", "wrapKey" or "unwrapKey", terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let data be the octet string contained in keyData.
If the length in bits of data is not 128, 192 or 256 then terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let jwk be the result of running the parse a jwk algorithm over keyData.
If the "kty" field of jwk is not a case-sensitive string match to "oct", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If jwk does not describe a valid JSON Web Key according to Section 6.4 of JSON Web Algorithms, terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let data be the octet string obtained by decoding the "k" field of jwk.

dl.dd: If the "alg" field of jwk is present, and is not a case-sensitive string match to "AES128CTR", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the "alg" field of jwk is present, and is not a case-sensitive string match to "AES192CTR", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the "alg" field of jwk is present, and is not a case-sensitive string match to "AES256CTR", terminate this algorithm with an error.
Terminate this algorithm with an error.

li.p: If the "use" field of jwk is present, and is not a case-sensitive string match to "enc", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the "key_ops" field of jwk is present, and does not contain all of the specified usages values, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the "ext" field of jwk is present and has the value false and extractable is true, terminate this algorithm with an error.

dl.dd: Terminate this algorithm with an error.

li.p: Let key be a new Key object representing an AES key with value data.
Let algorithm be a new AesKeyAlgorithm.
Set the name property of algorithm to "AES-CTR".
Set the length property of algorithm to the length, in bits, of data.
Set the algorithm property of key to algorithm.
Set the extractable property of key to extractable.
Set the keyUsages property of key to usages.
Return key.

dl.dd: Let data be the raw octets of the key represented by key.

li.p: Let jwk be a new internal object.
Set the kty property of jwk to the string "oct".
Set the k property of jwk to be a string containng the raw octets of the key represented by key, encoded according to Section 6.4 of JSON Web Algorithms.

dl.dt: If the length property of key is 128:
dl.dd: Set the alg property of jwk to the string "AES128CTR".
dl.dt: If the length property of key is 192:
dl.dd: Set the alg property of jwk to the string "AES192CTR".
dl.dt: If the length property of key is 256:
dl.dd: Set the alg property of jwk to the string "AES256CTR".

li.p: Set the key_ops property of jwk to equal the keyUsages property of key.
Set the ext property of jwk to equal the extractable property of key.
Let stringifiedJwk be the result of encoding jwk into a string according to the grammer specified in Section 15.12 of ECMA262.
Let data be the UTF-8|UTF-16 encoding of stringifiedJwk.
li.div: TODO: Decide whether this should be UTF-8 or UTF-16

li.p: Let keyData be a new ArrayBuffer containing data.
Return data.

div.p: This section is non-normative.
The "AES-CBC" algorithm identifier is used to perform encryption and decryption using AES in Cipher Block Chaining mode, as described in NIST SP 800-38A [SP800-38A].

When operating in CBC mode, messages that are not exact multiples of the AES block size (16 bytes) can be padded under a variety of padding schemes. In the Web Crypto API, the only padding mode that is supported is that of PKCS#5 and PKCS#7, as described by Section 6.1.1, p4 of RFC 2898 [RFC2898] and Section 10.3, p2 of RFC 2315 [RFC2315].
The recognized algorithm name for this algorithm is "AES-CBC".

li.p: If any of the members of AesCbcParams are not present in normalizedAlgorithm, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the iv property of normalizedAlgorithm does not have length 16 bytes, terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let padded-plaintext be the result of adding padding octets to ciphertext according to the procedure defined in Section 6.1.1 of RFC 2898 [RFC2898], step 4.

Let ciphertext be the result of performing the CBC Encryption operation described in Section 6.2 of NIST SP 800-38A [SP800-38A] using AES as the block cipher, the contents of the iv property of normalizedAlgorithm as the IV input parameter and padded-plaintext as the input plaintext.
Return ciphertext.
If any of the members of AesCbcParams are not present in normalizedAlgorithm, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the iv property of normalizedAlgorithm does not have length 16 bytes, terminate this algorithm with an error.

Let padded-plaintext be the result of performing the CBC Decryption operation described in Section 6.2 of NIST SP 800-38A [SP800-38A] using AES as the block cipher, the contents of the iv property of normalizedAlgorithm as the IV input parameter and ciphertext as the input ciphertext.
Let p be the value of the last octet of padded-plaintext.
If p is zero or greater than 8, or if any of the last p octets of padded-plaintext have a value which is not p, terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let plaintext be the result of removing p octents from the end of padded-plaintext.
Return plaintext.
If any of the members of AesKeyGenParams are not present in normalizedAlgorithm, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the length property of normalizedAlgorithm is not equal to one of 128, 192 or 256, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If usages contains any entry which is not a case-sensitive string match for one of "encrypt", "decrypt", "wrapKey" or "unwrapKey", terminate this algorithm with an error.

Generate an AES key of length equal to the length property of normalizedAlgorithm.
If the key generation step fails: Terminate this algorithm with an error Otherwise:
Let key be a new Key object representing the generated AES key.
Let algorithm be a new AesKeyAlgorithm.
Set the name property of algorithm to "AES-CBC".
Set the length property of algorithm to equal the length property of normalizedAlgorithm.
Set the algorithm property of key to algorithm.
Set the extractable property of key to be extractable.
Set the keyUsages property of key to be usages.
Return key.
If usages contains an entry which is not a case-sensitive string match for one of "encrypt", "decrypt", "wrapKey" or "unwrapKey", terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let data be the octet string contained in keyData.
If the length in bits of data is not 128, 192 or 256 then terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let jwk be the result of running the parse a jwk algorithm over keyData.
If the "kty" field of jwk is not a case-sensitive string match to "oct", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If jwk does not describe a valid JSON Web Key according to Section 6.4 of JSON Web Algorithms, terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let data be the octet string obtained by decoding the "k" field of jwk.

dl.dd: If the "alg" field of jwk is present, and is not a case-sensitive string match to "AES128CBC", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the "alg" field of jwk is present, and is not a case-sensitive string match to "AES192CBC", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the "alg" field of jwk is present, and is not a case-sensitive string match to "AES256CBC", terminate this algorithm with an error.
Terminate this algorithm with an error.

li.p: If the "use" field of jwk is present, and is not a case-sensitive string match to "enc", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the "key_ops" field of jwk is present, and does not contain all of the specified usages values, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the "ext" field of jwk is present and has the value false and extractable is true, terminate this algorithm with an error.

dl.dd: Terminate this algorithm with an error.

li.p: Let key be a new Key object representing an AES key with value data.
Let algorithm be a new AesKeyAlgorithm.
Set the name property of algorithm to "AES-CBC".
Set the length property of algorithm to the length, in bits, of data.
Set the algorithm property of key to algorithm.
Set the extractable property of key to extractable.
Set the keyUsages property of key to usages.
Return key.

dl.dd: Let data be the raw octets of the key represented by key.

li.p: Let jwk be a new internal object.
Set the kty property of jwk to the string "oct".
Set the k property of jwk to be a string containng the raw octets of the key represented by key, encoded according to Section 6.4 of JSON Web Algorithms.

dl.dt: If the length property of key is 128:
dl.dd: Set the alg property of jwk to the string "AES128CBC".
dl.dt: If the length property of key is 192:
dl.dd: Set the alg property of jwk to the string "AES192CBC".
dl.dt: If the length property of key is 256:
dl.dd: Set the alg property of jwk to the string "AES256CBC".

li.p: Set the key_ops property of jwk to equal the keyUsages property of key.
Set the ext property of jwk to equal the extractable property of key.
Let stringifiedJwk be the result of encoding jwk into a string according to the grammer specified in Section 15.12 of ECMA262.
Let data be the UTF-8|UTF-16 encoding of stringifiedJwk.
li.div: TODO: Decide whether this should be UTF-8 or UTF-16

li.p: Let keyData be a new ArrayBuffer containing data.
Return data.

div.p: This section is non-normative.
The "AES-CMAC" algorithm identifier is used to perform message authentication using AES with a cipher-based MAC, as described in NIST SP 800-38B [SP800-38B].
The recognized algorithm name for this algorithm is "AES-CMAC".
The recognized algorithm name for this algorithm is "AES-GCM".
This section is non-normative.
The "AES-CFB" algorithm identifier is used to perform encryption and decryption using AES in Cipher Feedback mode, as described in Section 6.3 of NIST SP 800-38A [SP800-38A].
The recognized algorithm name for this algorithm is "AES-CFB".
This section is non-normative.
The "AES-KW" algorithm identifier is used to perform key wrapping using AES, as described in [RFC3394].
The recognized algorithm name for this algorithm is "AES-KW".
The recognized algorithm name for this algorithm is "HMAC".
This describes using Diffie-Hellman for key generation and key agreement, as specified by PKCS #3.
The recognized algorithm name for this algorithm is "DH".

TODO: This interface is broken for import/export. Generate is defined in terms of PKCS#3 - meaning it takes base/g and prime/p - whereas the dhpublicnumber used by X.509/RFC 3279 uses the X9.42 form - meaning it takes base/g, prime/p, and subprime/q. The inconsistency here needs to be resolved before this can be reliably implemented.
This describes the SHA-1 and SHA-2 families, as specified by [FIPS 180-4].
The following algorithms are added as recognized algorithm names:

dl.dd: The SHA-1 algorithm as specified in Section 6.1
The SHA-224 algorithm as specified in Section 6.3
The SHA-256 algorithm as specified in Section 6.2
The SHA-384 algorithm as specified in Section 6.5
The SHA-512 algorithm as specified in Section 6.4

div.p: The "CONCAT" algorithm identifier is used to perform key derivation using the key derivation algorithm defined in Section 5.8.1 of NIST SP 800-56A [SP800-56A].
The recognized algorithm name for this algorithm is "CONCAT".
This section is non-normative.

The "HKDF-CTR" algorithm identifier is used to perform key derivation using the algorithm described in RFC 5869 [RFC5869] and NIST SP 800-56C [SP800-56C], using HMAC in counter mode, as described in Section 5.1 of NIST SP 800-108 [SP800-108].
The recognized algorithm name for this algorithm is "HKDF-CTR".

The definition of HKDF allows the caller to supply an optional pseudorandom salt value, which is used as the key during the extract phase. If this value is not supplied, an all zero string is used instead. However, support for an explicit salt value is not widely implemented in existing APIs, nor is it required by existing usages of HKDF. Should this be an optional parameter, and if so, what should the behaviour be of a user agent that does not support explicit salt values (is it conforming or non-conforming?)
The recognized algorithm name for this algorithm is "PBKDF2".

In the above snippet, password is an optional field. The intent is that conforming user agents MAY support applications that wish to use PBKDF2 by providing password entry via an un-spoofable (by the web application) UI.

The AlgorithmIdentifier typedef permits algorithms to be specified as either a dictionary or a DOMString. In order to ensure consistency, conforming user agents must normalize all AlgorithmIdentifier inputs into a single, canonical form. When normalization is indicated, it must act as follows:

ol.li: Let O be the AlgorithmIdentifier to be normalized.
Let result be the normalized output.

If O is a DOMString, then:
If O contains any non-ASCII characters, throw a SyntaxError and return from this algorithm.
Convert every character in O to lower case.
If O contains a recognized algorithm alias then let result be re-initialized to the aliased dictionary and this algorithm restarted, using result as the input to be normalized.
Otherwise, throw an InvalidAlgorithmError exception and return from this algorithm.

For each key K in O with an associated value V:
If the associated value V is an AlgorithmIdentifier, set the associated value for K in result to be the result of executing the algorithm normalization rules.
If the associated value V is a dictionary, set the associated value for K in result to be the result of executing this algorithm recursively for every value in the dictionary.
Otherwise, let the associated value for key K in result be the associated value for key K in O.

div.p: WARNING: This section is broken for purpose. Further, normalization at this degree is is no longer required, as the algorithm is never reflected back to the caller. Instead, specify how specific algorithms can/should validate the parameters - and how to perform DOMString substitutions.

div.h2: Mapping between JSON Web Key / JSON Web Algorithm
div.p: The following section is non-normative. Refer to algorithm-specific sections for the normative requirements of importing and exporting JWK.
Should the following be specified.

li.p: RSASSA-PKCS1-v1_5 with SHA-1
RSA-PSS with SHA-1
RSA-OAEP needs specifiers for the hash algorithms.
ECDSA with SHA-1
ECDSA where the curve (P-256, P-384, P-521) is not aligned with the hash (SHA-256, SHA-384, SHA-512)

div.p: The following section is non-normative. Refer to algorithm-specific sections for the normative requirements of importing and exporting SPKI.

The handling of "id-RSASSA-PSS" and "id-RSAES-OAEP" are tricky. RFC 5756 recommends implementations should not include parameters when PSS is used with a subjectPublicKeyInfo, and MUST NOT include parameters when OAEP is used. However, when OAEP is used as part of a key transport (as an AlgorithmIdentifier), implementations MUST include the parameters.
The natural conflict is in deciding when a key is being exported as part of a subjectPublicKeyInfo (which is what "spki" implies) and when it's being used as an algorithmIdentifier for transport.

div.h2: Mapping between Algorithm and PKCS#8 PrivateKeyInfo
div.p: The following section is non-normative. Refer to algorithm-specific sections for the normative requirements of importing and exporting PKCS#8 PrivateKeyInfo.
There does not appear to be a normative reference for a DH key being encoded as an INTEGER. Only RFC 5958 seems to mention this.
